actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow a refundable credit against the individual income tax for expenses paid in connection with the adoption of a child.

summary.text: Allows, under the Internal Revenue Code, a refundable credit of up to $200 against the individual income tax for expenses paid in connection with the adoption of a child. (Amends 26 U.S.C. 42)

titles.title: A bill to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1954 to allow a refundable credit against the individual income tax for expenses paid in connection with the adoption of a child.
